content.question: An air-filled parallel plate capacitor has a capacitance of <math alttext="C equals 12 picofarads" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>pF</mtext></mstyle></math>. The space between the plates is filled with a dielectric, and the new capacitance of the capacitor is <math alttext="C equals 48 picofarads" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>48</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>pF</mtext></mstyle></math>. What is the dielectric constant for the dielectric?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
